intro: Laphamia parryi, commonly known as the Parry's larkspur, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers are arranged in racemes. Laphamia parryi is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought conditions.
